title: N-Desmethylenzalutamide
text: "N"-Desmethylenzalutamide is a <a href="nonsteroidal%20antiandrogen">nonsteroidal antiandrogen</a> (NSAA) and the major <a href="metabolite">metabolite</a> of <a href="enzalutamide">enzalutamide</a>, an NSAA which is used as a <a href="hormonal%20antineoplastic%20agent">hormonal antineoplastic agent</a> in the treatment of <a href="metastatic">metastatic</a> <a href="prostate%20cancer">prostate cancer</a>. It has similar activity to that of enzalutamide and, with enzalutamide therapy, circulates at similar concentrations to those of enzalutamide at <a href="steady%20state%20%28pharmacokinetics%29">steady state</a>. "N"-Desmethylenzalutamide is formed from enzalutamide in the <a href="liver">liver</a> by the <a href="cytochrome%20P450">cytochrome P450</a> <a href="enzyme">enzyme</a>s <a href="CYP2C8">CYP2C8</a> and <a href="CYP3A4">CYP3A4</a>. It has a longer <a href="terminal%20half-life">terminal half-life</a> than enzalutamide (7.8 days versus 5.8 days).
